node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

clean_data.info: Whether to clean data before converting to string.

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

node.description:
# Blog Writing Flow Overview

Create a blog post by using content fetched from URLs and user-provided instructions.

## Prerequisites

* An [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/)

## Quickstart

1. Paste your OpenAI API key in the **Language Model** model component.
2.  In the **URL** component, enter URLs you want to fetch content from. Ensure they start with `http://` or `https://`.
3. Open the **Playground**. A blog post is written from the content fetched by the **URL** component.

input_data.info: Accepts either a DataFrame or a Data object.
input_data.name: input_data

mode.info: Convert into raw string instead of using a template.
mode.name: mode

pattern.info: Use variables within curly brackets to extract column values for DataFrames or key values for Data.For example: `Name: {Name}, Age: {Age}, Country: {Country}`
pattern.name: pattern

node.description: Fetch content from one or more web pages, following links recursively.

autoset_encoding.info: If enabled, automatically sets the encoding of the request.
autoset_encoding.name: autoset_encoding

check_response_status.info: If enabled, checks the response status of the request.
check_response_status.name: check_response_status

continue_on_failure.info: If enabled, continues crawling even if some requests fail.
continue_on_failure.name: continue_on_failure

filter_text_html.info: If enabled, filters out text/css content type from the results.
filter_text_html.name: filter_text_html

format.info: Output Format. Use 'Text' to extract the text from the HTML, 'Markdown' to parse the HTML into Markdown format, or 'HTML' for the raw HTML content.
format.name: format

headers.info: The headers to send with the request
headers.name: headers

max_depth.info:
Controls how many 'clicks' away from the initial page the crawler will go:
- depth 1: only the initial page
- depth 2: initial page + all pages linked directly from it
- depth 3: initial page + direct links + links found on those direct link pages
Note: This is about link traversal, not URL path depth.
max_depth.name: max_depth

prevent_outside.info: If enabled, only crawls URLs within the same domain as the root URL. This helps prevent the crawler from going to external websites.
prevent_outside.name: prevent_outside

timeout.info: Timeout for the request in seconds.
timeout.name: timeout

urls.info: Enter one or more URLs to crawl recursively, by clicking the '+' button.
urls.name: urls

use_async.info: If enabled, uses asynchronous loading which can be significantly faster but might use more system resources.
use_async.name: use_async

node.description: Runs a language model given a specified provider.

base_url_ibm_watsonx.info: The base URL of the API (IBM watsonx.ai only)
base_url_ibm_watsonx.name: base_url_ibm_watsonx

input_value.info: The input text to send to the model
input_value.name: input_value

ollama_base_url.info: Endpoint of the Ollama API (Ollama only). Defaults to http://localhost:11434
ollama_base_url.name: ollama_base_url

project_id.info: The project ID associated with the foundation model (IBM watsonx.ai only)
project_id.name: project_id

system_message.info: A system message that helps set the behavior of the assistant
system_message.name: system_message

description: Auto-generate a customized blog post from instructions and referenced articles.
name: Blog Writer
